member.name: Windows.DefScreenSaverProc
member.summary: Provides default processing for any messages that a screen saver application does not process.
member.param: The identifier of the screen saver window.

param.name: msg
param.para: The message to be processed. The DefScreenSaverProc function responds to messages that affect the screen saver's operation, as detailed in the Remarks section.
If a screen saver application must perform a different action in response to any of these messages, the application's window procedure should process the message.

member.returns: The return value specifies the result of the message processing and depends on the message sent.

member.name: Windows.RegisterDialogClasses

returns.para: Returns nonzero if successful, or zero otherwise.
To retrieve extended error information, call .

member.name: Windows.ScreenSaverConfigureDialog
member.summary: Receives messages sent to a screen saver's configuration dialog box. A screen saver that allows user configuration must define this function.
member.param: The identifier of the configuration dialog box.
A message that was sent to the screen saver's configuration dialog box.
member.returns: If the function successfully processes the message, it should return TRUE. If not, it should return FALSE, except in response to a WM_INITDIALOG message. In response to a WM_INITDIALOG message, ScreenSaverConfigureDialog should return FALSE if it calls the function to set the keyboard focus to one of the controls in the dialog box. Otherwise, the function should return TRUE, in which case the system sets the keyboard focus to the first control in the dialog box that can be given the focus.

member.name: Windows.ScreenSaverProc
member.summary: Receives messages sent to the specified screen saver window.
member.param: A message sent to the screen saver window.
member.returns: The return value is the result of the message processing and depends on the message sent.
